title: (x) Tub Hauler serif face - Imperator {Mike F}
content:
I’ve tried whatthefont with no luck. The T A and R are the unique letters here, but I am coming up empty

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706170202im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/ttt_4089.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Lastminute.com tech sans - FF DIN {Jan E}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706170202/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40791 "Go to previous forum topic") [New Optimus brand typeface ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706170202/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40844 "Go to next forum topic")
author: vector

comments.content: I know it, I just can’t think of the name. The R looks decidedly F. Goudy. Will hopefully remember.
[AT Classic Roman](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706170202/http:/www.fonts.com/FindFonts/detail.htm?pid=203065), this isn’t spot on but it’s close. The ’T’ and the ’R’ are very similar though.

The A and U are wrong in Classic Roman. I have started searching the Serif Guide. [Griffo Classico](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706170202/http:/www.bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/serifsamples/serif_fg/griffo_classico_full.gif) by Franko Luin has the structural earmarks, although the top serif on the A isn’t the same. I’m still looking.

- Mike Yanega

[Aviano](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706170202/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dooleytype/aviano/) has a similar head serif on the A and a similar R, but the rest of the letters are markedly different. Also, it is generously extended compared to the Tub Hauler sample.

The only other vaguely similar font I can find with a head serif on the A is [Imperium](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706170202/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/wiescherdesign/imperium/), but it is not as similar to the sample, and the rest of the letters are even less similar.

That’s [Paul Lloyd’s](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706170202/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/lloyd/index.htm) Imperator Small Caps Bold.

Except for a few experiments, Lloyd’s inspiration was type and lettering found in old sources. Unfortunately, he was a poor record keeper. He told me that himself, once, when I inquired about the inspiration for one of his fonts. Not only couldn’t he not give attribution for most of his fonts - he couldn’t even remember the source material for many. Somewhere, in some old catalog, magazine, graveyard or whatever is the original for this font - or at least the base Imperator Roman font. I wish I knew what that was.

Ah well. There are some jewels in his creations and I’m glad he made ’em.
Wow, nice find. Thank you so much for making my life easier.
